ai-dn4:24.4_0: Good Gotama, I go for refuge to you, and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-dn4:24.5_0: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.
ai-dn4:24.6_0: Would you and the Order of monks please accept a meal from me tomorrow?”
ai-dn4:24.7_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-dn4:24.8_0: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Soṇadaṇḍa got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-dn4:24.9_0: And when the night had passed Soṇadaṇḍa had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
ai-dn4:24.10_0: saying: “It is time, dear Gotama, the meal is ready.”
ai-dn4:25.1_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Soṇadaṇḍa together with the mendicant Saṅgha.
ai-dn4:25.1_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-dn4:25.2_0: Then Soṇadaṇḍa served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-dn4:26.1_0: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Soṇadaṇḍa took a low seat and sat to one side.
ai-dn4:26.3_0: “Master Gotama, if, when I have gone to an assembly, I rise from my seat and bow to the Buddha, that assembly might disparage me for that.
ai-dn4:26.4_0: And when you’re disparaged by the assembly, your reputation diminishes.
ai-dn4:26.5_0: When your reputation diminishes, your wealth also diminishes.
ai-dn4:26.6_0: But my wealth relies on my reputation.
ai-dn4:26.7_0: If, when I have gone to an assembly, I raise my joined palms, please take it that I have risen from my seat.
ai-dn4:26.8_0: And if I undo my turban, please take it that I have bowed.
ai-dn4:26.9_0: If, when I have gone to in a vehicle, I could bow to the Buddha, that assembly might disparage me for that.
ai-dn4:26.10_0: And when you’re disparaged by the assembly, your reputation diminishes.
ai-dn4:26.11_0: But my wealth relies on my reputation.
ai-dn4:26.12_0: If, when I am in a carriage, I hold up my goad, please take it that I have got down from my carriage.
ai-dn4:26.13_0: And if I lower my sunshade, please take it that I have bowed.”
ai-dn4:27.1_0: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired the brahmin Soṇadaṇḍa with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.
ai-dn4:27.2_0: The fourth section on Soṇadaṇḍa is finished.
